intro: Arequipiopsis rettigii, commonly known as the Arequipiopsis, is a species of flowering plant native to the high Andes of Peru. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces delicate, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Arequipiopsis rettigii is adapted to the cold, arid conditions of its native habitat, making it a resilient and unique member of the Andean flora.
